definition: to play around/to disport oneself
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
variant of 玩[wan2]/Taiwan pr. [wan4]
music
happy/cheerful/to laugh
surname Yue
surname Le
to eat, drink and be merry (idiom)/to abandon oneself to a life of pleasure

sentences.english: Life is not all beer and skittles, still love.
sentences.chinese: 生活并非只是吃喝玩乐，还有恋爱。

sentences.english: Life is not all cakes and ale.
sentences.chinese: 人生并不就是吃喝玩乐。

sentences.english: Life is not all beer and skittles .
sentences.chinese: 人生并不完全是吃喝玩乐。

sentences.english: His  spirit was vitiated by pleasure seeking.
sentences.chinese: 他的志气因追求吃喝玩乐而消磨殆尽。

sentences.english: Time flies when you're having fun.
Guys and Dolls crowded under the dim light with drinking, dancing, having fun.
sentences.chinese: 昏暗灯光下的红男绿女挤在一起喝酒，跳舞，玩乐。

sentences.english: Here’s an example: a few weeks ago my partner won a couple of thousand Dollars playing lotto.
sentences.chinese: 比如，几周前，我的伙计玩乐透中了几千美元的奖。
他们对无聊的玩乐不感兴趣。

sentences.english: Are you studying hard, or are you having fun?
sentences.chinese: 你是在努力学习还是在尽情玩乐呢？

sentences.english: Play hard , study hard , and work hard.
sentences.chinese: 尽情玩乐，用功读书，努力工作。

sentences.english: Can we have no higher aim in life than mere pleasure-seeking?
sentences.chinese: 我们难道没有比吃喝玩乐更高的人生目标吗？

sentences.english: Peking man speaks Chinese New Year is the beer and skittles, give priority to in order to eat.
sentences.chinese: 北京人过年讲得就是吃喝玩乐，以吃为主。

sentences.english: Thus, we become friends, and he took me played around the island, eating the seafood that tourist won't have chance to eat.
sentences.chinese: 于是朋友便交上了，之后更一起在兰屿吃喝玩乐。

sentences.english: There was no after-theatre lark, however, so far as Carrie was concerned.
sentences.chinese: 然而，就嘉莉而言，不存在什么散场后的玩乐。

sentences.english: But promoting play can be surprisingly challenging to parents.
sentences.chinese: 但倡导玩乐对家长来说是个意外的挑战。

sentences.english: Most telling, the purpose of the pavilion in the garden was misunderstood as a place for frivolous pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数的叙述中，亭台的作用被曲解为玩乐的地方。

definition: to enjoy life/pleasures of life
to eat, drink and be merry (idiom)/to abandon oneself to a life of pleasure
to eat and drink/food and drink
to while the time away/amusement/pastime/recreation/to make sport of
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
to play (as children do)/to amuse oneself
to entertain/to amuse/entertainment/recreation/amusement/hobby/fun/joy
to amuse oneself/to have fun/to go sightseeing/to take a stroll
to go on a scenic tour
to spend time in a bar (alcohol, Internet etc)/to go clubbing
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to indulge/to pamper/to connive at/permissive/indulgent/self-indulgent/unrestrained/undisciplined/uncultured/boorish
lit. trifling destroys the will (idiom); infatuation with fine details prevents one making progress/excessive attention to trivia saps the will
to go for an outing/to go on an excursion
playground
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
